results.title: Empty Land-New Life
results.brief_description: In 1956 the Ministry for Housing implemented the “Elderly Persons Housing Project” in an attempt to meet the growing demands for public housing by senior citizens. Over the years building costs have increased rapidly and the Ministry feels that if the Community were to donate land for the project this will enable them to continue building suitable accommodation at affordable prices.

results.title: Empowering people (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This instructional video uncovers the secrets of how to get people motivated to take more initiative, be more responsible, and reach their potential. Four main steps are recommended. One: empower yourself. This step is directed as managers/supervisors/team leaders; if managers behave like victims, externalising all their problems (i.e. blaming everyone and everything else) then staff will follow suit. Two: Demonstrate empowerment. For managers this means to accept responsibility for problems and go about fixing them your self. Three: give management guarantees that you (i.e. the employee) will implement suggestions. Four: take risks; directed at managers, the recommendation is to listen to and pilot staff ideas, not trounce on them, otherwise managers will be stymieing employees’ creative thinking and potentially losing out on implementing new and successful ideas.

results.title: Emergency obstetrics
results.creator_credit: Richard Scott, Medi-Cine and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Shows emergency medical technicians how to assist in emergency childbirth. Demonstrates step-by-step procedures showing two live births and the critical situation of a prolapsed umbilical cord. Narrated by Lynne Littman.

results.title: Emergency childbirth
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Paul Burnford Educational Films
results.brief_description: This film utilises actual birth footage along with animation, models and live-action in order to demonstrate the two main steps you will take in an emergency childbirth, ie evaluating the situation and assisting the delivery. In this instance the emergency birth is taking place in a park.

results.title: Emergency at Wallaby Creek
results.creator_credit: David Baker, Roger Mirams, Pacific Films and Rod McNeil
results.brief_description: An episode from the series: “The Terrific adventures of the terrible ten”. One of the boy’s of Ten Town falls ill and is taken to Ten town hospital. The boy hero of the story discovers dead fish in the dam and figures out that the aerial spraying from a crop duster is poisoning life in the area. He runs to tell the adults - there is no one in the police station - and the council water engineer won’t listen, so the hero goes and shuts down the town water supply to prevent poisoning. Cinematographer/Director of Photography: Bruce McNaughton

results.title: Embryonic development: the chick
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the development of the chick embryo, through all stages from germinal disc to hatching, employing animated diagrams and cine-micrography of the living embryo. Normal-speed and time-lapse photographic sequences, and animated diagrams, sometimes superimposed on microscopic views of the embryo, are used to clarify growth processes. (Five awards, including: Salerno; Golden Reel, USA)

results.title: Embroidery and printed textiles
results.creator_credit: John Fitzgerald and Educational Media Australia
results.brief_description: Filmed in a workshop situation comprised of fifteen people. David Green demonstrates and explains in an informal discussion with his participants the various techniques used in embroidery and print making. He stresses the importance of experimenting with ideas and that there is a “marriage between stitch, fabric and dye colour”. The camera gives us a close-up look at many interesting and vibrant designs.

results.title: Elvis: '68 comeback
results.brief_description: On June 27 & 28, 1968 at NBC-TV Studios, Burbank, California, Elvis Presley made his first appearance before a live audience since March 1961. It was intended to revitalise and reorientate his extraordinary career. It became a celebration of Elvis’ rock ‘n’ roll roots, a means whereby he could shake off the image of formula movies, sink his teeth into some raw raunch and prove that he was indeed the king of rock.

results.title: Elly
results.brief_description: Elly is a seemingly ‘got it all’ young woman who is forced to face the dark-side of her childhood relationship with her sister. Stars Marta Dusseldorp.
